main event: On October 6, 1953, in Albuquerque, New Mexico, Captain Jerald Cravens of the USAF observed unusual aerial phenomena as part of Project Blue Book.
interesting points: The observation involved lights traveling north with a dark reddish or dark color, stopping at the end of the observation, and falling onto a trail.
The phenomena were observed for approximately 4 seconds at a fairly cloudy sky, with specific degrees and directions noted.
A witness onboard the Panamanian SS Sea Adventurer also reported abnormal attraction to Minikoi Island on October 10, 1953.
The document indicates the presence of dense haze or weather overcast during the observation.
The UFO report was declassified 12 years after the event.
